title: ForCausality: A Curated Collection of Causal Inference Datasets and Tools
text: ForCausality package provides curated comprehensive collection datasets designed causal inference research. brings together data diverse domains clinical trials, cancer studies, epidemiological surveys, environmental exposures, health-related observational studies. package includes wide range data types, covering treatment outcomes, risk factors, survival data, case-control studies, exposure assessments. datasets enable researchers students perform causal analysis, risk evaluation, advanced statistical modeling, supporting applied work methodological development causal inference.

title: ForCausality: A Curated Collection of Causal Inference Datasets and Tools
text: dataset ForCausality package uses suffix denote type R object: _df: data frame

title: ForCausality: A Curated Collection of Causal Inference Datasets and Tools
text: selected example datasets included ForCausality package: Colon_df: Chemotherapy Stage B/C colon cancer Stroke_df: Fictional ischemic stroke data case control data risk factors, exposures confounders Pph_df: external control trial treatments post-partum hemorrhage

title: ForCausality: A Curated Collection of Causal Inference Datasets and Tools
code: # Summarize the number of patients per treatment group colon_summary <- Colon_df %>%   group_by(rx) %>%   summarise(count = n())  # Create a simple bar chart ggplot(colon_summary, aes(x = rx, y = count, fill = rx)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   labs(     title = "Number of Patients by Treatment Group",     x = "Treatment Group",     y = "Number of Patients"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   guides(fill = "none")  # Hide the legend since x-axis already shows groups

title: ForCausality: A Curated Collection of Causal Inference Datasets and Tools
text: ForCausality package provides well-curated collection datasets specifically tailored causal inference research. integrates data clinical trials, cancer studies, epidemiological surveys, environmental exposures, health-related observational studies. offering structured documented datasets, package facilitates causal analysis, risk assessment, advanced statistical modeling, serving valuable resource researchers, educators, students interested causal inference. detailed information full documentation dataset, please refer reference manual help files included within package.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tomás Valderrama. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Valderrama T (2025). ForCausality: Curated Collection Causal Inference Datasets Tools. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/Toby-codigos/ForCausality.

code: # Load the package library(ForCausality)  # Load a dataset from the package data(Colon_df)  # Show the first six rows of the dataset head(Colon_df)  # Display the structure of the dataset str(Colon_df)  # Summarize key variables summary(Colon_df)  # Visualize treatment groups and survival status table(Colon_df$treatment, Colon_df$survival)  # Open the dataset in the RStudio viewer View(Colon_df)
